comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

issue.title: www.eurointegration.com.ua

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

Ок. Эту задачу постоянно открытой держим. Если что - пишите.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://not.a.web.site](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnot.a.web.site) ### Comment > The problem is not with a certain website, it is in the App Store. > > What I noticed is when I have my private AdGuard DNS set, I'm not able to download any app, when I click get/install, is starting to load and it is stuck forever. > > If I switch in the AdGuard app to use Googles DNS, there is no problem I can download apps. If I switch to the public AdGuard DNS again I cannot download apps from the App Store. Oddly enough if I switch to the public AdGuard DNS w/out encryption I can download apps. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Хм, показывает наш сертификат. Реклама скорее всего в кэше осталась. Нужно будет очистить данные браузера, перезапустить его. Возможно [из-за `AdAway`](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/196169#issuecomment-2618441064) также потребуется перезапустить смартфон.

> На avito.ru рекламы нет, на m.avito.ru - есть

На смартфоне открывается только `m.avito.ru`, где реклама заблокирована.

issue.title: www.eurointegration.com.ua

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

probably should works.

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.8

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.prevea.com/medical-services/eye-care

### Ad Blocking

comment.body:
> gladiu777@gmail.com

Не повторяется. Без блокировщика вижу рекламу. Если проблема всё ещё присутствует, напишите на support@adguard.com со ссылкой `https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/196984#issuecomment-2614078932` 


Попробуйте выключить и снова включить контент-блокеры в настройках Сафари, а также обновить фильтры Адгарда.
Важно не закрывать окно Адгарда при обновлении фильтров в течение ~60 секунд, иначе iOS прервёт процесс применения фильтров.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://www.meijer.com/weeklyad.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.meijer.com%2Fweeklyad.html)
### Comment
> We are receiving an error at Meijer.com that just started occurring when using a browser that is behind AdGuard DNS.  The weekly ad no longer shows up on the site if we have AdGuard enabled.  While this is technically an ad, it isn't one that would ever pop up unintentionally-- you need to actually seek this out to find out what is on sale for the week, so I would label this a false positive.
Username: `@Balthanon`

issue.title: twitch.tv annoyance "Running ad block? Consider Turbo"

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Mac

### AdGuard version

2.16.3.1867

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.twitch.tv/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Dutch filter, AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Today while watching any stream a popup started to appear with text
> Running ad block? Consider Turbo.
> Twitch Turbo enables ad-free viewing while still supporting streamers.

There were [news recently](https://www.dexerto.com/twitch/twitch-joins-war-on-ad-blockers-by-hitting-users-with-discouraging-messages-3029595/) Twitch joined ad blocker war.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57b23b67-f567-427b-b780-2401ffe37e41)

</details>

It appears every couple of minutes, very annoying and unusable.

I also have ublock chrome extension, but I disabled it on twitch - didn't help.
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d47a7695-4303-42c3-84a8-9a6f89c7d5b6)

</details>

I also added all known twitch domains to the Adguard white list - didn't help either. Maybe there are some more exist
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5136a0df-901f-4570-80c0-6751942fbd0a)

</details>

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> Please check this rule:
> 
> twitch.tv##.video-player__overlay .player-overlay-background:has(> div[class^="Layout-"] > div[class^="Layout-"] > div[class^="Layout-"] > a:is([href*="/how-to-allow-ads-browser"], [href="https://www.twitch.tv/turbo"]))

I haven't watched streams on my Mac laptop for a while, but have tried now and the problem reappeared, even with this rule. Here is code of page

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7eef85a5-ee61-4dfc-a964-4f0d45e08fff)

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Mac

### AdGuard version

2.16.3.1867

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.twitch.tv/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Dutch filter, AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Today while watching any stream a popup started to appear with text
> Running ad block? Consider Turbo.
> Twitch Turbo enables ad-free viewing while still supporting streamers.

There were [news recently](https://www.dexerto.com/twitch/twitch-joins-war-on-ad-blockers-by-hitting-users-with-discouraging-messages-3029595/) Twitch joined ad blocker war.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57b23b67-f567-427b-b780-2401ffe37e41)

</details>

It appears every couple of minutes, very annoying and unusable.

I also have ublock chrome extension, but I disabled it on twitch - didn't help.
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d47a7695-4303-42c3-84a8-9a6f89c7d5b6)

</details>

I also added all known twitch domains to the Adguard white list - didn't help either. Maybe there are some more exist
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5136a0df-901f-4570-80c0-6751942fbd0a)

</details>

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
It's weird, if I'm not wrong, it looks the same on my end and previous rule should works.
Please check if rule like this works:
```adblock
twitch.tv##body
```
Whole content should be blank, it's just for test purpose.

issue.title: twitch.tv annoyance "Running ad block? Consider Turbo"

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Mac

### AdGuard version

2.16.3.1867

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.twitch.tv/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter

### Language-specific

AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Dutch filter, AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Today while watching any stream a popup started to appear with text
> Running ad block? Consider Turbo.
> Twitch Turbo enables ad-free viewing while still supporting streamers.

There were [news recently](https://www.dexerto.com/twitch/twitch-joins-war-on-ad-blockers-by-hitting-users-with-discouraging-messages-3029595/) Twitch joined ad blocker war.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57b23b67-f567-427b-b780-2401ffe37e41)

</details>

It appears every couple of minutes, very annoying and unusable.

I also have ublock chrome extension, but I disabled it on twitch - didn't help.
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d47a7695-4303-42c3-84a8-9a6f89c7d5b6)

</details>

I also added all known twitch domains to the Adguard white list - didn't help either. Maybe there are some more exist
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5136a0df-901f-4570-80c0-6751942fbd0a)

</details>

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Regarding my last comment: I've just figured out, Adguard was not being used when I tested your rule. The thing is, I configured a Proxy server in Chrome a couple of days ago. It turns out when a browser proxy is enabled (via addon) - system wide Adguard is just bypassed - they don't work together. I've fixed it by specifying a white list of sites for the proxy (not including Twitch ofc).

Now i'm testing your rule
`twitch.tv#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'edge.ads.twitch.tv/ads')`
